  9. (philosophy, natural science) the formal cause (the design, pattern, or pure concept of a thing, which gives form or structure to its matter, in Aristotelianism)
  10. (philosophy) form (summary of the manifold, the material of experience, into unity in consciousness - especially in Kant's philosophy)
  11. a norm (a rule that is imposed by regulations and/or socially enforced by members of a community)
  12. (in the plural) etiquette (the customary behavior of members of a profession, business, law, or sports team towards each other)
  13. (linguistics, grammar) a form (a grouping of words which maintain grammatical context in different usages; the particular shape or structure of a word or part of speech)
  14. (typography) a printing form (an object, usually in the shape of a block or a plate, used in printing to apply ink on the printed surface)
  15. (technology) an extruder (a machine that extrudes material through shaped dies)
  16. (physical) shape, form (a human or animal's physical condition, especially in terms of endurance and athletic performance)
